title.narrative: JUSTICE WITH EQUITY

description.narrative: By 2016, the justice system in areas where UNICEF has a presence (urban centres and municipalities enrolled in UNICEF Seal in the Semi-arid and Amazon) has increased their understanding to promote justice with equity, with particular attention to prioritizing special protection measures for adolescents under death threat, victims of sexual exploitation, street dwellers, heads of families and those in conflict with the law., which contributes to Access To Justice, Child Protection â€“ General, Justice For Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty, Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2016, National Child Rights Guarantee Systems (SGD) is strengthened at national and local level to ensure equitable realization of children's rights, including those living with disabilities, taking into account gender, race and ethnicity dimensions, with a focus on the Semiarid, Amazon and the prioritized urban centres.

related-activity.ref: 0540/A0/05/004 PCR 4. GROW UP FREE FROM VIOLENCE

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2016, the justice system in areas where UNICEF has a presence (urban centres and municipalities enrolled in UNICEF Seal in theSemi-arid and Amazon) has increased their understanding to promote justice with equity, with particular attention to prioritizingspecial protection measures for adolescents under death threat, victims of sexual exploitation, street dwellers, heads of familiesand those in conflict with the law.

description.narrative: A total of 1038 employees from the justice sector with improved capacities to conduct child-friendly forensic interviews. A situation analysis on the institutional capacity of 100 per cent judicial coordinating boards for children and adolescents rights improved their capability to deliver results in relation to children's access to justice. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2016

title.narrative: Dissemination and implementation of a Resolution issued by the National Council of Justice (CNJ) for the Judiciary SEAL initiative that includes criteria related to the application of socio-educational measures throughout Brazil.

target.value: 2015:Resolution disseminated in all jurisdictions of the territories in which UNICEF is active

actual.value: 2016:PCU: Resolution disseminated (via Digital Library Grow Up Free From Violence, email or in-person) to 1435 institutions and corporate foundations, state and municipal governments, civil society and universities.

title.narrative: Number of training and experience-exchange initiatives in the justice sector within the South-South cooperation framework.

actual.value: 2016:1. Best practices on open-custody measures from Brazil exchanged on a specialized event, “Son Adolescentes”, held by UNICEF Uruguay and the Office of the Special Representative of the Secretary-General. 2. UNICEF Brazil and Colombia exchanged experiences to strengthen the collaboration at the tripl

title.narrative: Number of magistrates and technical officials of the Judiciary branch trained in different areas disaggregated by gender, age, race, ethnic group, geographic location.

target.value: 2015:At least three legal operators (judges, technical officials of the Judiciary branch) trained in each jurisdiction of areas in which UNICEF is active

actual.value: 2016:One representative per Justice Coordinating Boards for Children and Adolescents (100 % of the Brazilian states and the Federal District) trained to provide information for the second national assessment on the status of the coordination boards for children.

title.narrative: Percentage of State-Level Justice Coordinating Boards for Children and Adolescents covering the territories in which UNICEF is active carrying out a situation analysis for Children's and Juvenile Courts and defining priority actions.

baseline.value: In Amazon, a preliminary analysis of the status of the Rights Guarantee System (SGD) has been carried out. In the other regions (SAB and PCU), there has been no analysis.

target.value: 2014:100% of the 27 justice coordinating boards in the territories in which UNICEF is active (PCU, SAB and PAM) with situation analyses carried out and priority actions being implemented

actual.value: 2016:A second assessment, including data from 100% of the Justice Coordinating Boards for Children and Adolescents, was finalized and discussed with the all the representatives of the National Association of the Coordinating Boards for Children and Adolescents of Brazil and the National Council of Justic
